p: The SH protein is a small molecule (amino acids and 64 PM, 7.5 kDa), which is inserted in the cytoplasmic membrane of the host cell via a hydrophobic sequence, ranging from 14 to 41 amino acids. The function of this protein has not yet been clarified ; however, because it is integrated in the membrane, it is assumed to be involved in adsorption, penetration, and denudation of the virus [ 33].
